meanings.definition: To cut or shape (something) incorrectly or badly.
meanings.sent1: She always miscuts the paper when trying to make origami.
meanings.sent2: The tailor miscuts the fabric, causing the dress to fit poorly.
meanings.sent3: The chef miscuts the vegetables, turning them into funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the shelf miscuts the wood, leaving it uneven.
meanings.sent5: The barber miscuts the hair, resulting in an uneven haircut.

meanings.definition: A piece of film or tape that has been cut or damaged during production.
meanings.sent1: The director was frustrated when he discovered several miscuts in the final edit.
meanings.sent2: The editor had to fix the miscuts in the film before it could be released.
meanings.sent3: The miscuts in the movie made the characters' actions seem confusing.
meanings.sent4: The miscuts in the tape caused the audio to skip in certain parts.
meanings.sent5: The miscuts in the film were noticeable to the audience during the screening.
